intro: Christella buwaldae, commonly known as the Bornean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within lowland forests. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth surface. Christella buwaldae is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
